files_processed.original_filename: /Users/dalecarman/Groove Jones Dropbox/Dale Carman/Projects/Bryan Rigg/_ORIGINAL_SOURCE/Bryan Rigg - D/Audio Tapes Hitler's Jewish Soliers/67 Egon Bahr (50% Jew),  13 Feb. 1995, Bonn, Ger. (Herr)/side B.mp3
original_issues: Numerous mistranslations and literal renderings that obscure meaning (e.g., 'עגיל' for 'ear thing' instead of 'דלקת אוזניים' or 'בעיה באוזן')
Confusion between 'alarm' (אזעקה) and 'alarm clock' (שעון מעורר), which is incorrect in context
Improper translation of idioms and military terms (e.g., 'מלא כוכבים' for 'full to the brim' instead of 'שיכור לגמרי')
Names and military ranks are inconsistently transliterated or translated (e.g., 'Zahankranaken' left untranslated, 'וויבל שדה' for 'Feldwebel')
Some sentences are garbled or nonsensical in Hebrew (e.g., 'הם היו אמורים ללכת לתעלה הרוסית ולקחת אותך בשבי' - 'take you prisoner' instead of 'take someone prisoner')
Frequent word-for-word translation leads to awkward, unnatural Hebrew syntax
Some German words are left in the text (e.g., 'ה-Schma'), which is not appropriate for a Hebrew translation
Punctuation and RTL issues, such as inconsistent use of periods and commas, and some sentences run on without clear separation
Some sections are omitted or truncated, and some details are lost or confused (e.g., 'fritsche' as 'הקרון השטוח שלי', which is not accurate)
Register and tone are inconsistent, sometimes too formal or too literal for the context
